Job_PostingObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_PostingObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_PostingObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Posting_Request_References.description: A unique identifier for a Job Posting requested.

description: Utilize the Request References element to retrieve a specific instance(s) of Job Posting and its associated data.

Job_Posting_Request_Criteria.description: Start Date of the Job Posting.
End Date of the Job Posting.
Name of the Job Posting Site. Specify the Job Posting Site by entering data here or in the Job Posting Site Reference.

Job_Posting_SiteObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_Posting_SiteObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_Posting_SiteObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Posting_Request_Criteria.description: Reference to the Job Posting Site. Specify the Job Posting Site by entering data here or entering the Job Posting Site Name.

Supervisory_OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Supervisory_OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Supervisory_OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Posting_Request_Criteria.description: Return Job Postings for a Supervisory Organization Reference.

Job_Requisition_EnabledObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Job_Requisition_EnabledObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Job_Requisition_EnabledObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Job_Posting_Request_Criteria.description: Return Job Postings for a Job Requisition Reference.
Only return Job Postings with a future Job Posting End Date.
Retrieves job postings that have been posted to an external career site.
Retrieves job postings with start dates on and before the current date.

External_Field_and_Parameter_Initializat.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Field_And_Parameter_Criteria_Data.description: Field And Parameter Initialization Provider Reference

description: Utilize the Request Criteria element to filter instance(s) of Job Postings by date, posting site, supervisory organization, job requisition, and active status.

validation.validation: No Job Posting Site exists with the provided Job Posting Site Name.
validation.description: A Job Posting Site Name was entered, but there are no Job Posting Sites in the current tenant with the specified name.

validation.validation: Enter only one of a Job Posting Site Name or a Job Posting Site Reference.
validation.description: Enter only one of a Job Posting Site Name or a Job Posting Site Reference.

validation.validation: End Date cannot be prior to Start Date.
validation.description: End Date cannot be prior to Start Date.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: The "Response_Filter" element contains common WWS information that allows you control the response data that you will be provided including As_Of_Date, As_Of_Entry_Moment, and Page attributes.

Job_Posting_Response_Group.description: Indicates if the Reference for the Job Posting is included in the response.
Indicates if the Job Requisition Restrictions Data is included in the response.
Indicates if the Job Requisition Definition Data is included in the response.
Indicates if the Position's Qualifications (Competencies, Education, Responsibilities, etc.) are included in the response.
Indicates if the Position's Open Job Requisition Attachments (if they exist) are included in the response.

description: The response group allows for the response data to be tailored to only included elements that the user is looking for.  If no response group is provided in the request then only the following elements will be returned:  Reference, Job Requisition Definition Data, and Job Requisition Restrictions Data.
